About

  • About
InnoPhase
  • Software Reference
  • AT Commands
  • Overview
  • View page source

Dual-Stack is a hosted solution with Talaria TWO Wi-Fi module which helps replace the normal Wi-Fi driver concept of Linux stack. This solution is designed to reduce power consumption without compromising the throughput performance for Linux based application SoCs used by ISPs, Industrial computers etc.

Dual-Stack provides the following advantages:

  1. Maintains Wi-Fi connectivity during host power off/sleep state.

  2. Supports low power.

  3. Easy to migrate across different kernel versions.

In this solution, the Wi-Fi driver software runs in the user space with minimal kernel modifications and makes use of the network stack on the Wi-Fi module for housekeeping tasks (such as cloud keepalive). The network stack on the Linux host is used to transfer high bandwidth data.

Figure 1: Software architecture block diagram

Following are the key advantages of the Dual-Stack solution:

  1. Solution is a user space program and hence easy to maintain.

  2. Portability across platform and kernel versions.

  3. Linux kernel modifications are minimal to support SPI/TUN.

  4. Existing socket applications will be able to run on the host without any modification.

  5. It provides a shadow service of sockets so that the always connected feature can be achieved even when the host is in sleep.

  6. FOTA and provisioning features are supported.

Connetion managerÔÉÅ

  • Commands
    • scan - Performs Wi-Fi Scan
    • connect ‚Äì Connects to Wi-Fi Network
    • disconnect ‚Äì Disconnects from Wi-Fi Network
    • IP ‚Äì Get/Set ipv4 Address
    • kaconfig ‚Äì Configures keepalive/shadow Service
    • kaconfigget ‚Äì Gets keepalive/shadow Service Configuration
    • kastart ‚Äì Starts keepalive/shadow Service
    • kastop ‚Äì Stops keepalive/shadow Service
    • kadel ‚Äì Deletes keepalive/shadow Service Configuration
    • status ‚Äì Gets Dual-Stack Status
    • wakeupconfig ‚Äì Configures Host Wakeup PIN
    • getwakeupreason ‚Äì Gets Host Wakeup Reason
    • wakeupreasoncls ‚Äì Clears Host Wakeup Reason
    • autoscanenable ‚Äì Enables Autoscan Operation
    • autoscandisable ‚Äì Disables Autoscan Operation
    • shutdown ‚Äì Triggers Host Shutdown
    • kasecconfig ‚Äì Configures Keepalive Security Parameters
    • wpmconfig ‚Äì Configures WLAN Power Management
    • powersave ‚Äì Suspend Enable/Disable on Talaria TWO
    • version ‚Äì Gets Version Information
    • cbenable ‚Äì Enable Connect/Disconnect Callback
    • fos ‚Äì Upgrade the WLAN firmware from Host
    • hcidevname ‚Äì Device Name
    • kasecconfigget ‚Äì Get Keepalive Security Parameters
    • wakeupcfgget ‚Äì Get Wakeup Configuration
    • autoscancfgget ‚Äì Get autoscan Configuration Status
    • wpmconfigget ‚Äì Get WLAN Power Management Configuration
    • tos ‚Äì Set TOS Parameter for Network Packets
    • disp_pkt_info ‚Äì Display Incoming and Outgoing Packet Information
    • kill-tun ‚Äì Gracefully Kills the Tunadapter
    • provstart ‚Äì Wi-Fi Provisioning over BLE
    • add - Adds packet forward configuration and prints rule ID
    • del - Deletes packet forward configuration
    • del-id - Deletes packet forward configuration by providing rule ID
    • query - Prints forward configurations
    • dirset/dirget - Sets/Gets packet forward direction
